https://studio.code.org/s/csc-mappinglan.short_instructions:
Hi! I’m a sprite, and you can make me say something. 
Connect a make new sprite and a say block to your code.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-mappinglan.long_instructions: **Hi! I’m a sprite, and you can make me say something. I’ll be your tour guide!** - Connect a make new sprite block under the set background block - Add a say block - Press Run Hint: You can change what I say!

authored_hints.hint1:
Drag a block from your toolbox and connect it under `when run`.

[][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-mappinglan.short_instructions: Practice changing this landmark’s location on the map.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-mappinglan.long_instructions: **Practice changing this landmark’s location on the map.** - Click the pin on the location block to move Mt. Rushmore to the Southwest area of South Dakota. - Press Run when you are finished.

authored_hints.hint1:
To change a sprite's location, click the pin on the location block, then click where you want it to go.
[][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-mappinglan.short_instructions: Use the new set size block to change the size of a sprite.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-mappinglan.long_instructions: **Let's learn to change the size of sprites.** - Use the new set size block to change the size of a sprite. - Make sure to choose a size other than `100`. _Bonus: Move the eagle so it is North of the tour guide._

authored_hints.hint1:
To set the size of a sprite just once, you can use this block:
[blockly block][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-mappinglan.short_instructions: Assign a `moving with arrow keys` behavior to the tour guide to move them around the map.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-mappinglan.long_instructions: **Get the tour guide moving around the map! Assign a behavior.** - Behaviors are actions the sprite performs over and over, like an animation. - Add a sprite begins moving with arrow keys behavior block. - Click Run and test it out by pressing your arrow keys.

dsls.markdown:
##Plan Your Landmarks Map

It's time to plan your own landmarks map.

You might create a map of your classroom, school, or city. Maybe you'll choose to feature state, regional, or national landmarks. Or you might choose to create a map based on an area you have studied in class. As you plan your map, think about the backgrounds, sprites, and speech you want to use to teach other people about the landmarks you have chosen. **Need some help getting started?** Use this resource to plan your work.

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-mappinglan.short_instructions: Start with adding a background to your project.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-mappinglan.long_instructions: **Add a background** - Add a set background block under when run. - Choose a background or upload your own. - Click Run to see the background appear.

dsls.markdown:
##Share Your Local Landmarks Map

Now that you have coded your map, it's time to share it out! First complete a short reflection on your project: 

>1. Explain your favorite part of your project.
>2. What was a useful block of code in your project?
>3. Explain one bug or challenge you faced when building your project.
>4. How did you fix the bug or overcome the challenge?
>5. What changes would you still like to make to improve your project?

As you present your work to your classmates, make sure to explain how your code works, what design choices you made, and the challenges you faced.
